metadata.title: CVE-2021-44718 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
wolfSSL through 5.0.0 allows an attacker to cause a denial of service andinfinite loop in the client component by sending crafted traffic from aMachine-in-the-Middle (MITM) position. The root cause is that the clientmodule accepts TLS messages that normally are only sent to TLS servers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl32 - 5.2.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.0-2').
